sources.title: Scrappy's Theme Song (1934)
sources.description: Scrappy and company are putting on a show in the barn. All they need is a good theme song for the balcony scene, which Scrappy writes. Unfortunately, while everyone else remembers the music, he keeps forgetting his part. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/scrappys-theme-song-1934/

metadata.Plot: Scrappy and company are putting on a show in the barn. All they need is a good theme song for the balcony scene, which Scrappy writes. Unfortunately, while everyone else remembers the music, he keeps forgetting his part.It's one of those improbably plotted Scrappy cartoons that flourished under series originator Dick Huemer. Even though the fantastic component of the device was absent in this one, it's nicely ornamented with the sort of detail that one often saw in live action series like Our Gang; and even though there's little need to have a cartoon do things that live action could do just as,easily, it's just enough over-the-top to satisfy.
